about.name: Jonas Friedmann
about.bio: 23 year old network administrator, OS X user, Linux enthusiast, allergic to animals with hair/fur.

package-snippets.name: package-snippets
package-snippets.description: Sublime Text 3 text snippets to quickly create Markdown files

additional.information: Sublime Text 3 text snippets to quickly create git/GitHub related Markdown files like README or license ones.

docker-ghost.name: docker-ghost
docker-ghost.description: Makefile to automate Docker image creation / instance restarts

additional.information: Makefile for easy and comfortable Ghost Docker image creation and instance restarts.

tar-multibackup.name: tar-multibackup
tar-multibackup.description: Bash script to backup and cycle tar archives

additional.information: Bash script to backup multiple folders and to clean up old backups based on a retention time. Some of the features: configurable post/pre-commands, tar excludes as well as retention.

google-speedtest-chart.name: google-speedtest-chart
google-speedtest-chart.description: Python script to create a beautiful Google Chart out of your speedtest results

additional.information:
Simple Python script to push speedtest results (using speedtest-cli) to a Google Docs spreadsheet. I use this to measure and track my upload and download bandwith.

[Click here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QvV6POBVBXuq5iXSOLNd5bwgd5To8FMuvsrSfvY7Nuk/pubchart?oid=1973311741&format=interactive) for an interactive demo (actually productive) version of the chart.
Dockerized version of @seejohnrun' haste-server pastebin clone written in NodeJS.

alfred-dongers.name: alfred-dongers
alfred-dongers.description: Alfred workflow to list unicode emoticons easily ໒(”•̀ᗜ•́”)७

additional.information:
Alfred workflow to quickly search and browse through unicode dongers via [dongerlist.com](http://dongerlist.com/). ╰|⁰෴⁰|╯

You can optionally list possible categories as well as show dongers out of a specific category by passing either "list" or "[category]" as second argument.

pushbullet-osx-services.name: Pushbullet OS X Services
pushbullet-osx-services.description: A Mac OS X services to push stuff to Pushbullet

additional.information:
Since the Mac OS X application for [Pushbullet](https://www.pushbullet.com/) ~~doesn't exist yet~~ is rather wonky, I thought about creating a simple workflow to quickly push images and text selections to your Pushbullet account just by using the right mouse click.

Make sure you've added your API key in "~/.pushbullet_apikey".

uping.name: uping
uping.description: Get notified as soon as a host is responding to ping.

additional.information:
(up)ing is a dead simple Bash script that continuously pings an host and let's you know as soon as its online or reachable (responding to ICMP ping) again. 

Bonus if you are on a Mac and have "terminal-notifier" installed: native OS X notifications through the Notification Center!

alfred-ciscocall.name: alfred-ciscocall
alfred-ciscocall.description: Alfred workflow to search for phone numbersthrough LDAP

additional.information:
Another Alfred.app workflow to quickly call or dial phone numbers on your Cisco IP phone via your Mac.

You might also want to checkout the sister workflow: [alfred-ldap](http://frd.mn/alfred-ldap)

docker-mailbox.name: docker-mailbox
docker-mailbox.description: Postfix, Dovecot, Roundcube and ViMbAdmin in a Docker boat

additional.information:
Docker image that ships a running Nginx/PHP, Dovecot, Postfix as well as ViMbAdmin web interface to manage and maintain the user accounts as well as the domain names.

This project is a work in progess, don't use it in production!

alfred-ldap.name: alfred-ldap
alfred-ldap.description: Alfred workflow to search for phone numbersthrough LDAP

additional.information:
Alfred workflow to search for telephone numbers of coworkers through an Active Directory/LDAP directory.

You might also want to checkout the sister workflow: [alfred-ciscocal](http://frd.mn/alfred-ciscocal)

dotfiles.name: dotfiles
dotfiles.description: Simple bork-based dotfile setup for both OS X and Linux systems.

additional.information:
Bork-based dotfile setup for Mac and Linux systems that is really simple and easy to understand.

Features:

* Dotfile wrapper based on [Bork](https://github.com/mattly/bork)
* Brew and Cask package check ensures that your packages are installed
* Mac App Store app check ensures that your OS X apps are installed
* npm (Node Package Manager) package check
* Ruby gem's check
* apt-get package check for Linux systems
* Sublime Text 3 package check (via [Package Control](packagecontrol.io))
* Commented code, so you know what is actually going on
* [Vundle](https://github.com/gmarik/Vundle.vim) VIm plugin manager
* Theme support for your prompts based on [oh-my-zsh](https://github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh/)
* Lightweight Atom package installer which uses a bundle [Atomfile](opt/Atomfile) (and apm of course)
* Hostname specific processing and customizations
* ZSH tab/auto completion
* [Powerline](https://github.com/Lokaltog/powerline) in vi and tmux
* [zsh-autosuggestions](https://github.com/tarruda/zsh-autosuggestions) plugin
* [zsh-history-substring-search](https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-history-substring-search) plugin
* [zsh-notify](https://github.com/marzocchi/zsh-notify) plugin

znc-logviewer.name: znc-logviewer
znc-logviewer.description: Node based web interface to browse through ZNC log files

additional.information:
Simple ZNC logviewer to lookup IRC log files via a web interface.

This project is a work in progess, don't use it in production!

Live.app.name: Live.app
Live.app.description: Live.app is a client side JavaScript web app to message your Xbox Live friends

additional.information: Live.app is a client side JavaScript web app to message your Xbox Live friends. It uses the great RESTful [XboxAPI.com](https://xboxapi.com) to communicate with Xbox Live. PouchDB is used as IndexDB/WebSQL storage to cache and deliver the actual informations more quickly and also to reduce the actual API calls to XboxAPI.

AndTekAgent.name: AndTekAgent
AndTekAgent.description: OS X application to quickly login and logout in a AndTek callcenter

additional.information: Simple Objective-C menubar application to control your agent status in a AndTek callcenter. Also features a sreensaver hook as well as a login and logout hook, so you don't have to bother to sign out manually. AndTekAgent will automatically set your status (via AndTek HTTP API).

CommuniGate-scripts.name: CommuniGate scripts
CommuniGate-scripts.description: Perl scripts for the CommuniGate Pro mail server system

additional.information:
Two little Perl scripts for CommuniGate Pro:

__listAndVerifyPasswords:__  
This script lists all accounts and their specific (plaintext if possible) passwords.

__bulkUpdatePasswords__:  
This script is useful in case you updated CommuniGate's default password encryption method. It'll update every single e-mail account without changing the current password. This way you can bulk update ALL exisiting mail accounts.

old.frd.mn.name: old.frd.mn
old.frd.mn.description: Repository of my old personal website

additional.information: Old glitch GIF website, which can be found here: [http://old.frd.mn](http://old.frd.mn).

ssltools.name: ssltools
ssltools.description: Bash scripts to analyze, troubleshoot and inspect SSL certificates

additional.information:
A bunch of Bash tools to analyze, troubleshoot or inspect SSL certificates, requests or keys: 

* [sslcsr](https://github.com/frdmn/ssltools#sslcsr) - simple decypher and parse informations out a CSR (Certificate Sign Request)
* [sslhost](https://github.com/frdmn/ssltools#sslhost) - get renewal informations and the CRT (certificate) itself based on a host

GiraHelper.name: GiraHelper
GiraHelper.description: Bash script to control the lights in my office

additional.information: Dead simple Bash script to talk to a Gira home server and toggle power outlets (office lights in my case). that speaks TCP (or actually HTTP). It knows TCP (actually HTTP) very well.
